title: Quiz 2: Maternal & Infant Health
description: Covers antenatal care protocols, immunization schedules, and maternal mortality factors.

questions.question: Identify the DIRECT causes of maternal mortality from the list below: (Select all that apply)

richContent.content: Note: Direct causes are complications of the pregnancy itself, while indirect causes are pre-existing conditions worsened by pregnancy.

questions.explanation: Hemorrhage, Sepsis, and Hypertension/Eclampsia are top direct causes. Malaria and Anemia are indirect causes.

questions.question: A fully immunized woman of reproductive age should have received ___BLANK___ doses of Tetanus Toxoid (TT) to ensure lifelong protection.
questions.explanation: 5 doses of Tetanus Toxoid are required to provide lifelong protection against tetanus.
questions.hint: It is an odd number less than 10.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a 'danger signal' regarding weight gain during pregnancy?

options.text: Gaining less than 1 kg per month
Any weight gain in the first trimester

questions.explanation: A gain of less than 1 kg per month in the second or third trimester is a danger signal for poor fetal growth.
questions.hint: Normal gain is usually more than this amount.

questions.question: Match the EPI delivery strategy with its description:
questions.explanation: Fixed = static clinics; Outreach = mobile teams for remote areas; Campaigns = mass events like Polio days.
questions.hint: Connect the location/method to the definition.

questions.question: Herd immunity is achieved when approximately 20% of the population is vaccinated.
questions.explanation: Herd immunity generally requires about 75% or more of the population to be immune to effectively stop transmission.
questions.hint: The percentage needs to be much higher.

questions.question: Which routine laboratory test is critical during the first ANC visit specifically to prevent congenital malformations and stillbirth?
questions.explanation: VDRL screens for Syphilis, which can cause severe congenital issues and stillbirth if untreated.
questions.hint: It tests for a sexually transmitted infection.

questions.question: What is the term for the care given to the mother and newborn immediately after the birth of the placenta up to 6 weeks?
questions.explanation: Postnatal care (PNC) covers the period from birth until 6 weeks postpartum.

questions.question: Select the correct vaccines that are LIVE attenuated vaccines. (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: BCG, OPV, and Measles are live attenuated vaccines. TT and DPT are toxoid/killed vaccines.
questions.hint: These vaccines are usually sensitive to heat and require freezing.

questions.question: Which of the following is an 'indirect' cause of maternal mortality related to the '3 Delays'?

options.text: Delay in reaching the health facility

questions.explanation: The '3 Delays' (seeking care, reaching care, receiving care) are indirect socio-economic causes. The others are direct medical causes.
questions.hint: It relates to logistics and decision making.

questions.question: Order the '3 Delays' that contribute to maternal mortality:

items.text: Delay in decision to seek care
Delay in reaching the health facility

questions.explanation: 1. Deciding to go. 2. Getting there. 3. Getting treated once there.
